lead_paragraph: LEVINE--Dr. Leonard J.,died February 29, 2016. A renowned Orlando plastic surgeon and former member of the Air Force Reserve Medical Corps, Len Levine was a truly extraordinary person. He was the most genuine of human beings. His kindness, warmth, laughter and humor will be missed by all. He dedicated his life to making the lives of those around him better, especially his family. Born March 20, 1943, he attended Wake Forest University, transferring to Monmouth University to complete his premedical studies. He received his Medical degree from the University of Bologna, interned at Beth Israel hospital in Newark, then trained in general and plastic surgery at Orlando Regional Medical center. He rose to department chief at Orlando's Lucerne Hospital. Dr. Levine was preceded in death by his mother, Clare. He is survived by his father, Irving Levine (wife Rose) of Boca Raton Florida; his daughter, Thea Rebecca Kovarik (husband Matt) and two granddaughters, Ava and Mila; his sister, Barbara Laufer (husband Sam) of Fair Haven, NJ, his three nephews Michael, David and James, his niece, Kate Laufer Gorenstein (husband Jeff) and great nephew, Will. Len is also survived by his partner in life, Carla DeLoach, with whom he experienced love, laughter, and many adventures. His spirit and generosity will continue on through his alma mater, Monmouth University, where he established an academic scholarship in his name. Donations can be made to this scholarship fund at Monmouth University or to The Orlando Health Foundation. 1/3
